jobs.title: Senior Technical Product Manager
jobs.description:
About Us

Ylopo, LLC is a rapidly growing marketing and technology company providing internet marketing services and proprietary lead generation and engagement software to successful real estate agents across the country. We are seeking an outgoing, tech savvy individual to join our growing team.

 

Why work for Ylopo?

At Ylopo we offer team members:

  • a commitment to personal development,

  • guidance and support at a high level through interfacing with our Executive Team to prioritize goals as a company,

  • excellent leadership and mentoring for our entry-level to senior staff, and recognition of outstanding efforts,

  • team building events, team lunches/ happy hours, and other company wide events

  • a supportive, caring environment dedicated to continuous learning and growth.

Overview:

Ylopo is a next-generation complete digital marketing solution designed for real estate teams and agents to capture and nurture people interested in buying or selling real estate. Ylopo leverages real estate specific, dynamic advertisements to generate interest, white labeled home search portals to engage, and cutting edge AI technology to multi-channel nurture prospects throughout their home buying journey. We help teams and agents grow their business and scale personalized relationships across their customer base with cost and time efficiencies. 

Product: Ylopo AI Suite

Our AI tools empower real estate teams and agents to effortlessly connect with their prospects at scale, leveraging call center and AI technologies to identify and adapt call strategies in real-time based on personalized consumer responses. Conversations are fully automated with natural and humanistic dialogues that will captivate interest and create transfers and appointments for our clients. Ylopo Voice offers reliable long-term prospect follow up, all the while integrating with our client’s preferred Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system of choice.  

Responsibilities:

  • Define, build, launch, and iterate on complex features and systems that move the product towards its vision.
  • Work with data scientists, machine learning engineers, and business stakeholders to define clear and actionable AI product requirements. Translate high-level AI concepts into user stories and technical specifications.
  • Orchestrate collaboration among all departments to support the product including but not limited to: creating sales deck with Sales team, drafting customer rollout strategy with Account Management team, defining operational workflows with Onboarding team, training Product Support team, coordinating product transitions or changes across all teams
  • Work autonomously and be able to take ownership of product decisions.
  • Use data analytics, user feedback, and AI model performance metrics to iterate on product features. Continuously measure and optimize the impact of AI-powered products.
  • Identify and mitigate potential risks related to AI development, including model bias, data quality, and ethical considerations.

 

Skills & Qualifications

  • 3+ years of Technical Product Experience following 3-5 years of Software Development.
  • At least 1 year with startup experience
  • Strong communication and leadership skills to steer stakeholders’ buy in and alignment
  • Strong project management and organizational skills to drive projects forward and facilitate collaboration across all teams
  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail 
  • A self-starter mindset, you aren’t afraid to roll up your sleeves and figure things out
  • Strong technical acumen, from being able to understand complex systems and logic to being able to follow engineering discussions around database schemas and APIs to ensure short and long term product use cases are met
  • Nice to Have: AI experience (chatbot, voice AI)
  • Nice to Have: Familiar with call center & telephony systems


This role is currently fully remote within the US, Working West Coast Hours. Compensation and full benefits include starting pay for $170k - $210k(we're flexible), depending on experience; medical, dental, and vision benefits; paid holidays, vacation, and sick days; a 401(k)

jobs.description:
About Us

Platform Engineering is reshaping how enterprises build and run their cloud-native setups, and Humanitec is leading this transformation. Our mission is to help teams build Internal Developer Platforms (IDPs) that unlock true developer self-service.

Through our community-driven initiatives, like platformengineering.org and PlatformCon, we are not just following the trend, but defining it. With a growing list of enterprise customers and skyrocketing IDP adoption, we are expanding our team.

This is where you come in.

We are looking for a Senior Product Manager who is obsessed with building great products for software development teams on cloud-native technologies. If you want to build a product that helps engineering teams succeed, and understand DevOps, SRE, and modern infrastructure, we would love to hear from you.

About the Role

We are on a mission to redefine how enterprises build and scale Internal Developer Platforms, and our Humanitec Platform Orchestrator is at the core of this revolution. As a Senior Product Manager, you will drive its evolution, working hand-in-hand with peers in Product, Design, and Engineering to develop tools that enable real Platform Engineering adoption.

This is not a traditional, big-company PM role. You won’t just be writing tickets. You will be shaping how modern infrastructure is built and operated at scale. You will define and build out our product strategy, collaborate deeply with engineering and others across the organization, and ensure our platform doesn’t just deliver technical value, but also helps teams navigate the cultural and organizational change required for successful adoption.

To thrive in this role, you need to be highly technical, deeply passionate about the space, and excited about pushing the boundaries of what's possible.

This is a fully remote position, and we work in small, senior, agile teams. Preferred time zones for this role are UTC-1 to UTC+3.

What You Will Bring:

  • Excellent communication & collaboration: You can translate deeply technical concepts into clear, compelling narratives for engineers, executives, and customers alike.

  • Product management skills: At least 5 years of experience in product management, preferably in a technical product, with a track record of owning roadmaps from concept to launch.

  • Deep technical expertise: You have either worked as an engineer or built products for engineers. You understand cloud infrastructure, DevOps tooling, and platform engineering concepts inside-out.

  • A strong opinion on what great Developer Experience looks like: You are passionate about making life easier for engineering teams and have a deep understanding of how developers work.

  • Hands-on experience with modern cloud technologies: You have practical knowledge of Kubernetes, Docker, IaC (Terraform, OpenTofu), CI/CD, cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure), and developer tooling.

  • A bias for action: You thrive in fast-moving, ambiguous environments where decisions need to be made quickly.

What You Will Do:

  • Shape the future of Platform Engineering: Define and execute a product strategy that impacts engineering teams globally.

  • Drive product direction: Identify pain points, gather customer insights, and define user-centric requirements for product personas.

  • Work hand-in-hand with engineers: Collaborate with engineers to ensure technical feasibility, scalability, and a world-class user experience for our products on web, command-line tools, IaC, etc.

  • Define what great DX looks like: Simplify onboarding and activation for customers new to Humanitec.

  • Strengthen our go-to-market efforts: Work closely with marketing and sales to drive adoption and position our platform as a category leader.

If this sounds like a fit, we would love to hear from you! Have questions before applying? Reach out to us at careers@humanitec.com

jobs.title: Product Owner
jobs.description:
Company Description

ATPCO is the foundation of flight shopping, providing pricing and retailing data, tools, and services to 500+ airlines, global distribution systems, sales channels, and technology companies. In addition, ATPCO links the entire airline community together, collaborating to develop industry standards for airline distribution and end-to-end technology solutions. As a result, ATPCO solutions work seamlessly across existing, new, and evolving technologies and methods from shopping to settlement. Airline-owned and reliably supporting air travel for more than 55 years, ATPCO is everywhere people buy flights.

We consider qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, gender, age, color, religion, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, disability, sexual orientation, protected military/veteran status, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, or any other legally protected factor.



Job Description

As a Product Owner, you report to the Product Manager and lead execution of business delivery of product enhancements. Your focus is to develop a deep understanding of your product and its capabilities. This role is responsible for working with the product, engaging with customers and colleagues, and staying abreast of industry trends. Your product is your passion. 

In this role, you will work closely with designers, business analysts, quality analysts, and developers to solve specific customer problems outlined by the Product Manager. Your primary tools are personas, stories, and backlogs, focusing on what features will address selected business problems planned for future releases. 

This role is within ATPCO’s Create The Offer portfolio, which focuses on allowing airlines and their technology providers to most effectively create the offers, price points, and conditions associated with tickets and ancillary purchases. The products you will primarily work on in this portfolio are in growth mode with agile teams that are focused on high velocity product delivery.  

This role will be focused on innovation and out-of-the-box features in our existing products, and new products that support our customers and users on the path to dynamic offer creation. 

Key Responsibilities: 

1. Vision and Goal-Setting: Lay out the vision and goals for the project feature within the overall product development team. Define the target audience for the solution and inspire the team with real stories about real people to help them grasp the vision and goals. 

2. Collaboration and Inspiration: Act as the voice of the customer, representing their needs to the product development team. Collaborate effectively with business analysts, designers, quality, and engineering team members, using real-life examples to drive home the product's vision and persona goals. 

3. Backlog Management and Prioritization: Manage the product backlog diligently. Prioritize deliverables, continually manage the list of stories, and provide context and business value to the team. Clarify success criteria and define specific results for the acceptance of deliverables. 

4. Requirements and Roadmap Development: Assist in requirements definition, adjustments, and clarifications. Help define success criteria. With direction from the Product Manager, create and maintain a feature roadmap that enables a practical delivery approach, solving identified business problems and sequencing the stories for delivery. 

5. Reporting and Monitoring: Monitor and report on the project development status. Keep track of metrics like the number of prioritized items pending, work in progress, items completed pending acceptance, and items accepted. 

6. Customer and Market Expertise: Support the team with product and market expertise, ensuring every team member understands the customer perspective and the market dynamics. 

7. Collaborative Business Focus: While maintaining a business-centric focus, interact with technology stakeholders when necessary, ensuring that technology initiatives align with business requests and product enhancements. 

8. Data Analysis: You back up your roadmap and product decisions by looking at product usage data. Using your technical skillset, you implement systems, logging, and dashboards to report on feature adoption. 

Skills and Competencies: 

- Strong skills in creating and using personas, stories, and backlogs as primary tools for expressing customer needs and product features. 

- Ability to inspire and collaborate with a diverse team, driving them towards a shared vision. 

- Excellent communication skills, capable of conveying complex ideas effectively to various stakeholders. 

- Adept at prioritizing tasks and managing a product backlog to align with business goals. 

- Proficient in monitoring and reporting project progress, with an eye for detail and a commitment to excellence. 

 

As a Product Owner on our team, you will be pivotal in bridging the gap between customer needs and the technical execution of our product roadmap, all while maintaining a keen focus on solving real business problems. Your role is crucial in ensuring that our product not only meets but exceeds the expectations of our customers and stakeholders. 

The Ideal Candidate: 

  • At least 2 years of experience with Data analysis 

  • At least 2 years of experience working with ATPCO subscription data 

  • Familiarity with New Distribution Capability, Dynamic Offers, and Web Fare data 

  • Experience with product management 

  • Experience with writing and communication of business requirements 

  • Experience creating wireframes and mockups 

  • Experience working with API products 

  • Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel 

  • Proficiency with SQL 

  • Understanding of basic SaaS business metrics 

Salary Range: $112,950–$160,400

*The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for applicable geographic differential associated with the location*



Qualifications


Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

About the Product Manager at Headspace:

At Headspace, our B2B products help millions of employees and health plan members access the mental health care they need. As a Product Manager in the B2B organization, you’ll play a critical role in shaping our employer and partner-facing experiences, leveraging data systems, automation, and engagement tools to drive adoption and impact. You will be responsible for building scalable solutions that enhance employer engagement, improve client reporting, and optimize internal tools to better support our partners. If you're passionate about data-driven decision-making, growth, and creating seamless employer experiences, this role is for you!

What you will do:

  • Develop and execute the product strategy for employer engagement mechanisms, including challenges, marketing automation, and branded experiences.
  • Own and enhance Headspace’s B2B client reporting capabilities, ensuring robust, scalable, and insightful data reporting for our partners while collaborating with the Client Reporting team on strategic partner needs.
  • Lead improvements to internal stakeholder management tooling, enabling customer success, sales, and account teams to better support our enterprise partners.
  • Support B2B2C operations and escalations, working closely with cross-functional teams to streamline issue resolution and optimize the user experience.
  • Drive data system enhancements that enable more effective decision-making, reporting, and analytics across our B2B ecosystem.
  • Collaborate with engineering, design, marketing, and commercial teams to define, prioritize, and deliver high-impact product initiatives.
  • Develop product requirements, define success metrics, and ensure seamless execution of the B2B roadmap.
  • Act as a primary escalation point for B2B and partner-related product issues, coordinating responses and long-term improvements.

What you will bring:

Required Skills:

  • Product Experience: Minimum of 2 years of product management experience, defining product requirements, success metrics, working with engineering teams, & iterating products over time. 
  • Data Proficiency: Strong understanding of data structures, reporting tools, and analytics methodologies to drive product insights and decision-making.
  • B2B Product Experience: Familiarity with employer engagement strategies, partner marketing, and enterprise SaaS models.
  • Growth & Optimization Expertise: Experience optimizing digital engagement, automation, and reporting tools to increase product adoption and partner success.
  • Project Management: Ability to manage cross-functional projects with multiple stakeholders, ensuring alignment and timely execution.
  • Technical Acumen: Understanding of software development processes and ability to work closely with engineering teams.
  • Stakeholder Management: Strong collaboration skills with internal teams (sales, customer success, engineering, marketing) to drive alignment and execution.
  • Problem Solving: Ability to navigate complexity and ambiguity while delivering practical, scalable solutions.

Preferred Skills:

  • Experience working with enterprise clients, especially in the health and wellness or HR tech space.
  • Familiarity with business intelligence and analytics platforms (e.g., Looker, Tableau, DataBricks, Amplitude).
  • Experience with marketing automation tools and customer engagement platforms.
  • Knowledge of employer benefits ecosystems and how digital health solutions fit within them.
  • Background in SaaS, B2B2C, or marketplace models.

Pay & Benefits:

The base salary range for this role is determined by a number of factors, including but not limited to skills and scope required, relevant licensure and certifications, and unique relevant experience and job-related skills. The base salary range for this role is $107,123-$133,903.

At Headspace, cash salary is but one component of our Total Rewards package. We’re proud of our robust package inclusive of: base salary, stock awards, comprehensive healthcare coverage, monthly wellness stipend, retirement savings match, lifetime Headspace membership, generous parental leave, and much more. Paid performance incentives are also included for those in eligible roles. Additional details about our Total Rewards package will be provided during the recruitment process.

How we feel about Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging:

Headspace is committed to bringing together humans from different backgrounds and perspectives, providing employees with a safe and welcoming work environment free of discrimination and harassment. We strive to create a diverse & inclusive environment where everyone can thrive, feel a sense of belonging, and do impactful work together. 

As an equal opportunity employer, we prohibit any unlawful discrimination against a job applicant on the basis of their race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, family or parental status, disability*, age, veteran status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We respect the laws enforced by the EEOC and are dedicated to going above and beyond in fostering diversity across our workplace. 

*Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the terms of the Americans with Disabilities Act and certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is a change in the way things are normally done which will ensure an equal employment opportunity without imposing undue hardship on Headspace. Please inform our Talent Acquisition team by filling out this form if you need any assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application or interview process.

Headspace participates in the E-Verify Program.

Privacy Statement

All member records are protected according to our Privacy Policy. Further, while employees of Headspace (formerly Ginger) cannot access Headspace products/services, they will be offered benefits according to the company's benefit plan. To ensure we are adhering to best practice and ethical guidelines in the field of mental health, we take care to avoid dual relationships. A dual relationship occurs when a mental health care provider has a second, significantly different relationship with their client in addition to the traditional client-therapist relationship—including, for example, a managerial relationship.  

As such, Headspace requests that individuals who have received coaching or clinical services at Headspace wait until their care with Headspace is complete before applying for a position. About us

Our mission is to deliver the best experience possible to as many donors of blood products (such as plasma) as possible, in as many communities as possible. We use our understanding of blood product donation and the industry’s regulations and pair them with our extensive consumer product experience to enrich the lives of our members and improve health outcomes for patients everywhere.

In an industry that hasn’t seen innovation in more than two decades, Buoy’s software streamlines the donation process allowing our business to promote loyalty while improving efficiency in a donation center. In turn, the increase in blood product donations improves a supply level that is at an all time low, and allows for blood-product derived biotherapies to continue to evolve, improve, and save lives for those who face life-threatening conditions (i.e. immune deficiencies and blood disorders). Without an increase in blood product donations, we are facing a worldwide health crisis that ultimately results in rationing of care without the proper resources. Buoy Software is excited to be playing more of a role in improving the state of blood products and blood product donations.

We’re working alongside Join Parachute (www.joinparachute.com/) in the opening of small market donation centers across the country that will create local donation center careers, opportunities to donate blood products, and provide financial compensation for those donations that will have a positive economic impact in those communities.

The need for blood products is growing rapidly. We want to close the gap in blood product supply and demand by empowering organizations with the right tools. Buoy is the intuitive, data-driven mobile application for donors.


Qualities that will make you successful:

Take charge: Own all phases of product roadmap for your product pod from discovery to delivery.

Thrive in complexity: Buoy builds products for customers working in a highly regulated industry. Regardless of your role at Buoy, you will play a role in the broader mission of supporting our products providing a better experience to donors, center staff, and customers whether you work in product, support, design, operations, or engineering.

Have a point of view: Hold strong opinions, loosely held. Be willing to present your own thoughts and work together to come to the best solution.

Be collaborative: Work across functions in order to make sure work is feasible, meeting quality standards and delivering value.

Demonstrate Business & Technical Acumen: Be able to articulate your decisions with logical rationale supported by the needs of the user, business, project requirements and feedback from subject matter experts and teammates.

Embody a can-do attitude: As a startup, sometimes our jobs require us to work outside of our traditional roles in order to get work across the finish line. While your primary role will be product manager, you may be asked at times to assist with other product-related tasks necessary to get work completed.

Startup Mentality: You enjoy building, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and can adapt to change easily.


About The Role
As a Senior Product Manager at Buoy, you will play a crucial role in solving complex problems through collaboration and innovation. You’ll work on high-impact projects, partner with senior stakeholders, and lead cross-functional teams to define and execute strategies for your product pod(s). This person will be joining our medical device product pod.


Why This Opportunity Is Exciting

Mission-Driven Impact: Contribute to a cause that helps others and transforms a traditional industry.

Innovative Environment: See your ideas come to life through our rapid and iterative development process.

Meaningful Work: Your contributions will directly impact our members’ financial health and improve outcomes for blood-product recipients.


Where you'll be
We deeply believe in distributed teams at Buoy. We build projects around motivated individuals. We give our team the environment, support and trust they need to get the job done.

Working hours? We operate within the Eastern and Central Standard time zones for effective collaboration we ask that all applicants be located that time zone.



What you'll do as a Sr. Product Manager...
  • Drive discovery, requirement gathering, sequencing, and iteration to new and existing features in our software suite
  • Define quarterly objectives and plans for a pod(s) designed to advance business goals
  • For your projects you’ll frame the questions, evaluate facets of a problem, derive solutions and evaluate possible outcomes collaboratively with the pod(s)
  • Navigate tradeoffs and deliver stakeholder-aligned recommendations
  • Partner with engineering and design to evolve agile practices, and drive key rituals & practices (refinement, planning, story writing, etc)


    • Who you are...
  • You are an experienced product manager with an exceptional product craft and toolkit.
  • You are comfortable with complex systems and working within a regulated space. You know how to analyze and decompose a complex system and communicate that complexity simply and clearly.
  • You have technical platform product management experience.
  • You can operate & communicate at multiple levels, from discussing business strategy with senior leadership to writing clear user stories for the pod(s).
  • You’re able to bring clarity to complex and ambiguous situations.
  • You’re effective in collaborating across teams, functions, and levels.
  • You know how to approach constraints and make tradeoffs in your roadmap, while balancing business and technical priorities.
  • You’re able to handle multiple moving pieces and adapt to changing scope or timelines.
  • You’re empathetic, you understand other disciplines and bring everyone together using clear communication and strong structured thinking.


    • In the first 30 days as Product Manager, you will...
  • Begin using the product, diving deep into the inner workings to understand the requirements behind the software and understanding the jobs being done
  • Dive in, ask questions, and start to get your hands dirty — you’ll be learning a lot and we know there’s a curve!
  • Take your time absorbing how the teams work today, what is currently in design/development, learn about what is on the horizon
  • Schedule meetings with stakeholders and teams to understand the product suite offerings today and in the future
  • Learn and begin to absorb the various regulatory requirements
  • Become familiar with all necessary product metrics, roadmaps and business goals


    • In the first 60 days, you will...
  • Work more independently - creating briefs, gathering requirements, running meetings etc
  • Take ownership of roadmap planning - what is the team currently prioritizing, what would you suggest they start to prioritize, and what is the current plan to build and release
  • Assess any low hanging fruit or opportunities to prioritize short term pieces of the roadmap
  • Begin the ability to forecast and communicate to business stakeholders what features are nearing completion and any related tasks that may need attention outside of software team
  • Begin running product strategy meetings with the product team
  • Begin absorbing how higher level strategic business planning and goal setting is working


    • In the first 90 days, you will...
  • Become even more autonomous. You should start to feel comfortable leading, running, and communicating, taking the reigns of the product
  • Establish trust amongst your colleagues/peers and across the company to begin articulating how the team’s roadmap ladders up to core business objective and what impact their work will have on the greater ecosystem of our customers and Buoy.
  • Own sequencing of features against strategic priorities.
  • Start to work independently, taking on work, begin building documentation and process, and laying the foundation as you start to settle in
  • Begin developing your necessary product development processes with all relevant stakeholder - how are we doing roadmap planning, how are we measuring success of features etc.
  • Ship your first feature.
    • ---
    Employment at Buoy Software is contingent upon achievement of satisfactory results on your background check and reference check and your ability to provide proof of your identity and eligibility to accept employment in the United States.

    At Buoy Software, we believe in empowering our team to work in a way that suits them best. We offer a fully remote work environment and flexible schedules so you can balance your career and personal life on your terms. Your health and well-being are important to us, which is why we provide comprehensive insurance coverage (medical, vision, dental) to ensure you're taken care of. We also offer a 401(k) program to help you plan for the future, generous parental leave to support you during those important life moments, and a home office stipend to help you create a workspace that inspires productivity and comfort. Join us and be part of a company that values innovation, flexibility, and your overall happiness.

jobs.title: Senior Product Manager, Growth
jobs.description:
Hi, we’re CompanyCam.

We’re a simple-to-use photo documentation and productivity app for contractors of all commercial and home services industries. Packed with intuitive functionality, CompanyCam facilitates unparalleled communication and accountability across a contractor’s entire business. We’re committed to providing a consumer-grade, game-changing experience that helps our users build trust within their company and with their customers.

But don’t let that corporate description fool you—the people behind our buttoned-up product are laid-back (but hardworking), genuine, and kickass, and you could be one of them! 

What We Care About

One Team: We don't think of ourselves as "Product Managers", "Engineers", "Data Analysts", or "Acquisition Marketers". Beyond denoting skill sets and areas of expertise, we don't think departments matter. We'd rather align ourselves to the goals we're working to achieve and make sure we have the necessary subject matter expertise to drive meaningful impact. We strive to orient ourselves around customer problems TOGETHER – getting the right people with the right context, in the right rooms(Zooms) to solve problems holistically.

We question everything and are precious about nothing: Ideas can and should come from anywhere, and we aren't tied to our own. Product Managers are not the exclusive purveyors of great ideas. We proactively source inputs from all directions. We talk to our customers regularly and are quick to change course if we know there's a better or more impactful way to deliver value.

We consider the customer journey in all of our decisions: We understand that no interaction exists in a silo and therefore understand how important every single one is. We ensure our strategy sets prospective and new customers up for success and drives long-term retention. We answer questions and address problems early and proactively. We understand the value of different channels, initiatives, and messages and know how to holistically articulate impact and advocate for prioritization.

We Execute For Impact: When we stick the landing, we have the opportunity to impact small business owners across the country. Our continued growth is directly correlated to the outsized value we produce for our busy customers.

We De-risk Assumptions: We are not beholden to ideas. We have goals and believe everything beyond that is a series of hypotheses to validate. We constantly ask ourselves, "What's the most important thing I should be working on right now? How do I confirm or reject that assumption as fast as possible?". We rarely have timelines/deadlines and constantly take in new information and adjust our priorities accordingly. We don't expect to be perfect the first time, but by de-risking assumptions and remaining customer-focused, we tend to be pretty on target.

How You'll Make An Impact
  • Drive growth through comprehensive, end-to-end initiatives that span insight generation, experimental design, and cross-functional execution, including:
    • Designing sustainable growth loops with viral product features and network effects
    • Leading pricing and packaging strategies through rigorous experimentation
    • Conducting deep-dive analyses of user behavior, conversion funnels, and retention patterns
    • Leveraging sophisticated statistical analysis to validate hypotheses and optimize growth levers
  • Build and maintain relationships across engineering, data, design, finance, and marketing teams, proactively sharing insights and achieving cross-functional alignment
  • Develop and implement comprehensive growth strategies across owned channels (digital and mobile) to drive adoption and retention of new features while maintaining the highest levels of trust in the CompanyCam brand
  • Launch new features, build new mobile and web experiences, craft product positioning, develop business requirements, and define success metrics
  • Deeply understand our products and customers to build frictionless and delightful customer journeys (e.g. discovery, onboarding) that maximize adoption and retention
  • Build and maintain growth models to forecast the impact of various initiatives and help prioritize our roadmap
We’re Excited About You Because
  • You bring 5+ years of growth-focused product experience, with a proven track record of driving business impact through data-driven experimentation, including:
    • Pricing optimization and packaging initiatives
    • Designing and analyzing A/B tests
    • Breaking down complex problems with curiosity and analytical rigor
  • You're a strategic thinker who looks around corners, thinking several steps ahead while maintaining an ability to communicate complex ideas clearly
  • You have strong cross-functional collaboration skills, understanding that impact comes from empowering others rather than doing everything yourself
  • Your background reflects a blend of analytical depth and product vision – whether you were a data analyst who wanted to build products or a product person with a passion for data

Bonus Points

  • You're familiar with and have used the set of practices outlined in Continuous Discovery Habits by Teresa Torres
  • You’ve spent a good portion of your career developing consumer-facing solutions
About The Growth Team

We have four principles

  1. Holistic thinking: We know that nothing exists in a silo
  2. Disciplined prioritization: We substantiate the size of the opportunity we’re pursuing
  3. Data-driven decision-making: We use first principles and are skeptical.
  4. Proactive collaboration: We build context together and encourage synchronous, streamlined work from our colleagues and diversity in problem-solving

Benefits & Compensation

This is a salaried position at CompanyCam. Our salary range is $145,000 - $165,000 per year and is based on experience.We also offer meaningful equity and other benefits.

We pride ourselves on celebrating everyone. CompanyCam is an equal-opportunity employer actively working on creating an inclusive work environment where everyone can thrive. Are you reading this and wondering if you meet every requirement? Studies show that workplace minorities, such as women and people of color, are less likely than other applicants to apply for a job when they don’t meet every single requirement. Even if your experience doesn’t perfectly align, we encourage you to apply. We’re interested in hiring passionate, hard-working people—not checking boxes.

For any accommodations or adjustments to complete the online application or to participate in the interview process, please email jobs@companycam.com and we’ll respond to your email promptly. Do not include any medical or health information in your email.

  • Successfully collaborated with Infrastructure, Security, IT, and Product Engineering teams on balancing engineering efficiency in alignment with compliance and security 
    • Strong partnership with technical stakeholders in very technical domains
  • Experienced crafting a strategic vision and roadmaps, evangelizing your vision, and executing against it over multiple years

    • Successfully developed continuous feedback between customer insights and team priorities

If you don't think you meet all of the criteria above but still are interested in the job, please apply. Nobody checks every box, and we're looking for someone excited to join the team.

  • Ability to manage risk and make data-driven decisions to prioritize features, ensuring product quality and regulatory compliance.

  • Passion for making a difference and changing the world.

With BVNK, businesses can send and receive stablecoin payments, convert between currencies, and add stablecoin payments to their checkout. Using our flexible platform, and robust global licensing and compliance expertise, innovators can launch new payment products quickly and compliantly.

We are a diverse team spread across the UK, Europe, South Africa, the US, and APAC, with a shared belief that all payment flows will interact with crypto in the coming decade, and BVNK will be at the forefront of this transformation of the financial system. We have raised $50M in Series B funding from top investors, including Haun Ventures, Tiger Global, and Coinbase Ventures, and we're looking for smart, ambitious people to help us build the next generation of payments.

The Fiat Payments Processing Platform is central to BVNK’s fiat capabilities. The platform aims to enable other teams working with fiat payments (Banking, Virtual Accounts, TechFinance, GSN/FX) to scale and decrease the delivery cycle. You’d also enable Layer1 to leverage BVNK’s fiat capabilities, which is key for our Fiat Orchestration strategy. The role includes a high level of cross-team collaboration and demands strong payment processing and technical knowledge.

Our Product and Engineering organisation is split into small autonomous teams, which are each built to be able to execute their own strategies independently whilst collaborating with the rest of the organisation.   • Identify and adopt best practices in payment processing.

What you can expect from us:

  • Meaningful ownership in the business through our employee option scheme
  • Flexible working hours, with hybrid working at its heart
  • A culture built on passionate growth-minded people
  • A flexible approach to holiday
  • Opportunities to travel to our offices around the world
  • An open and creative environment where you can help us define the future of BVNK, its culture, and its opportunity sets

 

At BVNK, we are focused on building a diverse and inclusive team. While you may not meet all of our requirements, we’d encourage you to apply if you meet the majority of our expectations. You may be a great fit for this role or another role in our team.

GOBankingRates.com is a leading destination for personal finance news and information. 

Launched by Jeff Bartlett and Brett Rossmann in 2004, GOBankingRates (formerly ConsumerTrack) connects people with products and services that help them to lead a richer life.

We are a multi-media content platform covering all aspects of your personal finance journey. Our curated editorial content, videos and podcasts utilize expert insight to teach readers the six key principles of financial literacy: how to earn, save, invest, spend, borrow and protect money. ABOUT THE ROLE

Who we are:

We create innovative digital products (mobile and web apps, reward & survey systems, machine learning&gaming platforms, and more). Among our clients you will find both large and small businesses.

SANDBX was established in 2017 as a small startup and has grown to be a significant player with a solid portfolio of 50+ projects! We are proud of our state-of-the-art technology stack and the in-house culture. We love what we do, say what we feel, and practice what we preach. Really into your job and not into office politics? This is the place for you!

We are looking for people who love what they do and are good at it. During the hiring process, you’ll discover that being able to fit into our company culture is equally important. We cherish our laid-back, easy-going atmosphere and stay away from office drama.

The Product:

Neu.ro is a startup Sandbx has heavily invested in. Its main product is an MLOPS platform - a tool allowing ML practitioners to deploy, train and run their models on various platforms (Cloud, on premise etc.) without dealing with the low level Devops tasks. Potentially New.ro can also optimize Devops costs for ML oriented companies by creating the most efficient Devops architecture and also by running the jobs in the best times. For this reason New.ro also positions itself as a “Green AI” platform.

In addition, on top of New.ro and using New.ro ML skills, Sandbx provides various ML consulting services for various clients. These engagements can be short term consulting engagements as well as long term projects.

Requirements

The Role:

The position is multifaceted and encompasses a combination of Business Analyst responsibilities such as gathering requirements from stakeholders, creating specifications, developing user stories, and conducting demos, along with Project Manager duties such as implementing development processes, approaches, and task tracking tools, ensuring on-time delivery, improving information flow and product feedback loops, managing stakeholder relations and balancing competing interests. Additionally, there are some pre-sale tasks involved such as running discovery workshops for potential clients, gathering requirements, creating an initial project outline, and assisting with time and effort estimates. Overall, the role has complete end-to-end responsibility for product or service implementation.

The Candidate Profile:

The ideal candidate for this position should have a background in either SW or QA engineering and a good understanding of Agile methodology. They should be skilled in managing both processes and people, enjoy building successful teams, and be confident in managing change and relationships.

The role will involve customer-facing responsibilities and pre-sales activities, so the candidate must be fluent in English and have some experience or interest in pre-sales. The development team's primary stakeholders are in the US, so the TPM should be able to work later hours.

Requirements:

  • min 2 years of previous experience as a developer or a QA
  • min 3 years experience as a Business Analyst, Project or Program manager or similar in a complex environment
  • strong communication and relationship management skills
  • change management skills
  • sufficient business analyst proficiency (requirements elicitation, user story/spec writing, task decomposition, etc)
  • very good people management skills and overall interest to pursue people management path
  • fluent English
